newsitem.title: INDIA: India fire the latest in series of disasters.
newsitem.headline: India fire the latest in series of disasters.

text.p: The fire which tore through a famous Hindu temple in southern India on Saturday, killing at least 50 worshippers, was the latest disaster to strike the world's second most populous nation.
Following is a chronology of disasters in India over the past 13 years:

December 1984 - Deadly gas leaks from a pesticide plant owned by U.S.-based Union Carbide Corp in central city of Bhopal, killing some 6,500 people and injuring 20,000 in world's worst industrial disaster.
June 1985 - Air-India plane explodes and crashes into sea off the coast of Ireland, killing 329 people. Sikh extremists claim responsibility.
November 1985 - Sixty people killed when a boat capsizes in northern state of Uttar Pradesh.
January 1986 - A fire in a luxury hotel in the Indian capital kills 38 people, including 22 foreigners.
November 1986 - Nearly 40 killed when an avalanche sweeps away a highway in Jammu and Kashmir state.
April 1987 - A devastating fire guts a tribal settlement in Orissa state, killing 20 people and injuring 100. Nearly 2,500 houses are destroyed, leaving 13,000 homeless.
August 1988 - Poisoned cooking oil paralyses more than 400 people in the eastern city of Calcutta.
November 1988 - Some 100 people killed in a cyclone that strikes southern part of West Bengal state.
March 1989 - At least 125 people die in the western state of Gujarat after drinking lethal bootleg liquor.
May 1990 - A cyclone ravages southern state of Andhra Pradesh, killing nearly 1,000 people.
November 1991 - At least 185 people die in New Delhi after consuming cheap herbal tonic laced with raw alcohol.
January 1992 - Liquor laced with methyl alcohol kills 82 revellers celebrating the New Year in Bombay.
February 1992 - Nearly 50 people die in a stampede at a Hindu religious bathing festival in Tamil Nadu state.
May 1992 - About 210 people die after consuming poisonous liquor in Orissa.
August 1995 - At least 335 people are killed in one of India's worst train crashes near New Delhi.
September 1995 - About 70 miners are drowned when water from a flooded river gushes into two coal mines in Bihar state.
December 1995 - Nearly 425 people die when a blaze rips through a school prize-giving ceremony in the northern town of Dabwali in Haryana state, near the Indian capital.
July 1996 - Thirty-nine Hindu devotees are killed when scores of worshippers stampede through a temple complex at Ujjain in central state of Madhya Pradesh.
August 1996 - Nearly 225 Hindu devotees killed in cold weather during an annual trek to a holy cave in the Himalayas.
November 1996 - A Saudi Arabian Boeing 747 jumbo jet and a Kazakhstan Ilyushin cargo plane collide near New Delhi, killing 351 people in the world's deadliest mid-air collision.
November 1996 - More than 900 people are killed in a cyclone that savages the country's southeastern coast.
December 1996 - Seventy Hindu devotees killed when a truck carrying them plunges into a pond in Bihar state.
February 23 1997 - A raging fire sweeps through bamboo straw shelters at a Hindu convention in Orissa killing at least 120 devotees and injuring 165.
June 7, 1997 - A major fire engulfs a famous Hindu temple in southern India killing at least 50 worshippers and injuring 100.
